description: Sound system layer: phonetics (how sounds are made) and phonology (how sounds function in a system).

topics.name: Phonetics Essentials
coreClaims: Articulatory features explain how consonants and vowels are produced (place/manner/voicing).
Transcription is a tool for precision and pattern discovery.
practice: Allophones: identify predictable variants in context.

topics.name: Phonology Patterns
coreClaims: Phonological rules describe systematic alternations (e.g., assimilation) without treating them as errors.
Stress and rhythm affect intelligibility and perceived fluency.
practice: Mark stress patterns in multisyllabic words.
Explain a reduction pattern in fast speech vs careful speech.
